column5: Got out again tonight with the family looking for some carp and I wasn't disappointed. My son was in the fishing mood so I let him handle the uglistick.    No more than 15 minutes at the spot and I had the first one on. My son decided that he wanted to help bring it in so he grapped on and found out that carp a a little more powerful than him!      So we got it in and it was a decent 23 1/2" with a few battle scars on her.    She decided to get back at me and kick 5 pounds of mud on me during the release. Thankfully my wife didn't have the camera.  In the next 30 minutes I got quite a few hits but couldn't get the hook set. Finally I got another one on and brought it in by myself this time. But Jacob did join me for the picture    Had a few more hits before it got dark but it was time to get the baby to sleep. It was another great evening with the family and a great way to forget about the day at work.  Dan
Fantastic report Dan!  Looks like a great time out.  Your son shouldn't feel bad about losing to a carp...When I was a kid, I had quite a few similar incidents which will remain untold
lol my friend had something happen hooks into a nice 20+ and it decided to go for a run and we where on slick mud so he ended up in the water and rod went bye bye  u fishing in a small pond?
It's a good size creek with a big pool in one spot.
You found a honey hole in there. Good going! Love the shot of muddy pants lol
Looks like you had a great time mud and all.

Great job once again! That seems like a nice little creek to fish at. I'm sure it won't be long before your son land his first carp, and don't be suprised if that one is bigger than all of the ones you have been catching
Great report and pics Dan  Looks like you guys had a blast out there     Congratulations to all of you Thanks for sharing Leechman
